oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3441-1 -- perl -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: David Golden of MongoDB discovered that File::Spec::canonpath() in Perl returned untainted strings even if passed tainted input. This defect undermines taint propagation, which is sometimes used to ensure that unvalidated user input does not reach sensitive code.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3413-1 -- openssl -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL, a Secure Sockets Layer toolkit.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3414-1 -- xen -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Multiple security issues have been found in the Xen virtualisation solution, which may result in denial of service or information disclosure.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3415-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3426-1 -- linux -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service, information leak or data loss.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3423-1 -- cacti -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several SQL injection vulnerabilities have been discovered in Cacti, an RRDTool frontend written in PHP. Specially crafted input can be used by an attacker in the rra_id value of the graph.php script to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the database.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3439-1 -- prosody -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in Prosody, a lightweight Jabber/XMPP server.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3443-1 -- libpng -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the libpng PNG library.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3411-1 -- cups-filters -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Michal Kowalczyk discovered that missing input sanitising in the foomatic-rip print filter might result in the execution of arbitrary commands.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3429-1 -- foomatic-filters -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Michal Kowalczyk and Adam Chester discovered that missing input sanitising in the foomatic-rip print filter might result in the execution of arbitrary commands.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3433-1 -- samba -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3412-1 -- redis -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Luca Bruno discovered an integer overflow flaw leading to a stack-based buffer overflow in redis, a persistent key-value database. A remote attacker can use this flaw to cause a denial of service (application crash).

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3430-1 -- libxml2 -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in libxml2, a library providing support to read, modify and write XML and HTML files. A remote attacker could provide a specially crafted XML or HTML file that, when processed by an application using libxml2, would cause that application to use an excessive amount of CPU, leak potentially sensitive information, or crash the application.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3427-1 -- blueman -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: It was discovered that the Mechanism plugin of Blueman, a graphical Bluetooth manager, allows local privilege escalation.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3410-1 -- icedove -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3417-1 -- bouncycastle -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Tibor Jager, Jörg Schwenk, and Juraj Somorovsky, from Horst Görtz Institute for IT Security, published a paper in ESORICS 2015 where they describe an invalid curve attack in Bouncy Castle Crypto, a Java library for cryptography. An attacker is able to recover private Elliptic Curve keys from different applications, for example, TLS servers.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3422-1 -- iceweasel -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Multiple security issues have been found in Iceweasel, Debian's version of the Mozilla Firefox web browser: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, use-after-frees and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, bypass of the same-origin policy or denial of service.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3420-1 -- bind9 -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: It was discovered that the BIND DNS server does not properly handle the parsing of incoming responses, allowing some records with an incorrect class to be accepted by BIND instead of being rejected as malformed. This can trigger a REQUIRE assertion failure when those records are subsequently cached. A remote attacker can exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service against servers performing recursive queries.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3442-1 -- isc-dhcp -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: It was discovered that a maliciously crafted packet can crash any of the isc-dhcp applications. This includes the DHCP client, relay, and server application. Only IPv4 setups are affected.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3438-1 -- xscreensaver -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: It was discovered that unplugging one of the monitors in a multi-monitor setup can cause xscreensaver to crash. Someone with physical access to a machine could use this problem to bypass a locked session.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3440-1 -- sudo -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: When sudo is configured to allow a user to edit files under a directory that they can already write to without using sudo, they can actually edit (read and write) arbitrary files. Daniel Svartman reported that a configuration like this might be introduced unintentionally if the editable files are specified using wildcards, for example.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3424-1 -- subversion -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Ivan Zhakov discovered an integer overflow in mod_dav_svn, which allows an attacker with write access to the server to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3419-1 -- cups-filters -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Adam Chester discovered that missing input sanitising in the foomatic-rip print filter might result in the execution of arbitrary commands.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3409-1 -- putty -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: A memory-corrupting integer overflow in the handling of the ECH (erase characters) control sequence was discovered in PuTTY's terminal emulator. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to mount a denial of service or potentially to execute arbitrary code.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3431-1 -- ganeti -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Pierre Kim discovered two vulnerabilities in the restful API of Ganeti, a virtual server cluster management tool. SSL parameter negotiation could result in denial of service and the DRBD secret could leak.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3432-1 -- icedove -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Multiple security issues have been found in Icedove, Debian's version of the Mozilla Thunderbird mail client: Multiple memory safety errors, integer overflows, buffer overflows and other implementation errors may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or denial of service.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3435-1 -- git -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Blake Burkhart discovered that the Git git-remote-ext helper incorrectly handled recursive clones of git repositories. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitary code by injecting commands via crafted URLs.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3425-1 -- tryton-server -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Cédric Krier discovered a vulnerability in the server-side of Tryton, an application framework written in Python. An authenticated malicious user can write arbitrary values in record fields due missed checks of access permissions when multiple records are written.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3416-1 -- libphp-phpmailer -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Takeshi Terada discovered a vulnerability in PHPMailer, a PHP library for email transfer, used by many CMSs. The library accepted email addresses and SMTP commands containing line breaks, which can be abused by an attacker to inject messages.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3418-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3408-1 -- gnutls26 -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: It was discovered that GnuTLS, a library implementing the TLS and SSL protocols, incorrectly validates the first byte of padding in CBC modes. A remote attacker can possibly take advantage of this flaw to perform a padding oracle attack.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3437-1 -- gnutls26 -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Karthikeyan Bhargavan and Gaetan Leurent at INRIA discovered a flaw in the TLS 1.2 protocol which could allow the MD5 hash function to be used for signing ServerKeyExchange and Client Authentication packets during a TLS handshake. A man-in-the-middle attacker could exploit this flaw to conduct collision attacks to impersonate a TLS server or an authenticated TLS client.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3444-1 -- wordpress -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Crtc4L discovered a cross-site scripting vulnerability in wordpress, a web blogging tool, allowing a remote authenticated administrator to compromise the site.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3421-1 -- grub2 -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Hector Marco and Ismael Ripoll, from Cybersecurity UPV Research Group, found an integer underflow vulnerability in Grub2, a popular bootloader. A local attacker can bypass the Grub2 authentication by inserting a crafted input as username or password.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3434-1 -- linux -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leak.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3436-1 -- openssl -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Karthikeyan Bhargavan and Gaetan Leurent at INRIA discovered a flaw in the TLS 1.2 protocol which could allow the MD5 hash function to be used for signing ServerKeyExchange and Client Authentication packets during a TLS handshake. A man-in-the-middle attacker could exploit this flaw to conduct collision attacks to impersonate a TLS server or an authenticated TLS client.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3428-1 -- tomcat8 -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: It was discovered that malicious web applications could use the Expression Language to bypass protections of a Security Manager as expressions were evaluated within a privileged code section.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: DSA-3445-1 -- pygments -- security update
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Javantea discovered that pygments, a generic syntax highlighter, is prone to a shell injection vulnerability allowing a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharacters in a font name.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: EOL: DSA-3314-1 typo3-src -- end of life
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Upstream security support for Typo3 4.5.x ended three months ago and the same now applies to the Debian packages as well. Newer versions of Typo3 are no longer packaged in Debian, so the recommended alternative is to migrate to a custom installation of Typo3 6.2.x (the current long term branch)..
